chapter.title: Introduction : Certification Approach
chapter.para: This document provides steps you can use to certify your HPCC environment.
Use this procedure when you create a new HPCC system or after you make any changes or upgrades to the system. This will ensure that your system is functioning properly.

You can also use all or some of these procedures on a regularly scheduled basis or before mission critical data processing.
We suggest reading this document in its entirety before beginning. The entire process can take about an hour.

sect1.title: Scope
sect1.para: These procedures certify the following functional areas:

listitem.para: System Machine Readiness
Data Transfer from Data Refinery to Landing Zone
Data Transfer from Landing Zone to Data Refinery
Data Refinery Functions
Certify Data Refinery full sort capabilities
Certify Data Refinery local sort capabilities
Certify Data Refinery local dedup capabilities
Certify Data Refinery hash dedup capabilities
Certify Data Refinery compress I/O capabilities
Certify Data Refinery string search capabilities
Certify Data Refinery Engine key build capabilities
Certify Data Delivery Engine access to indexed data
Certify Rapid Data Delivery Engine access to indexed data
Data Delivery Engine Functions
Rapid Data Delivery Engine Functions

sect1.title: Before You Begin

listitem.para: Ensure the _Certification module exists.
Ensure all certification data files have been deleted from the DFU (start clean).
Ensure all certification Workunits and DFU Workunits have been deleted.
Ensure that all certification Roxie queries have been deleted.

sect1.para: The system build delivers some files, these files defined as ECL attributes. Filenames and other variables are defined in the _Certification.Setup attribute. There is some other ECL code which is delivered as sample/example code.***

chapter.title: PreFlight
chapter.para: The best way to certify the system is installed and configured properly is to run preflight on the components. This ensures that all machines are operating and have the proper executables running. This also indicates if there is adequate disk space and available memory, and have acceptable CPU % values.

listitem.para: Open ECL Watch on http://IPaddress:8010/
Replace IPaddress with the actual IP address of your system, where ECL Watch is loaded.

row.entry: Note: That your IP address could be different from the ones provided in this example. Please use the IP address provided by your installation.

para.emphasis: Enter the Login ID and Password provided.

listitem.para: Click on the System Servers link under Topology.
A screen similar to the following should display.
Press the Submit button at the bottom of this page to start preflight.

sect2.title: EXPECTED RESULTS:
sect2.para: After pressing Submit, a screen similar to the following should display.

System Component Inforamtion
This screen displays info on several system components. This information indicates weather several components are actually up and running appropriately or not. At a glance this screen can instantly alert you if any of these components are or are not running.

listitem.para: Click on the Cluster Processes link under Topology.
Click on the mythor link.
Check the Select All checkbox (if necessary).
Press the Submit button to start preflight.

sect2.title: EXPECTED RESULTS:
sect2.para: After pressing Submit, a screen similar to the following should display.

ESP mythor system component information
This screen displays info on several system components. This information indicates weather several components are actually up and running appropriately or not. At a glance this screen can instantly alert you if any of these components are or are not running.

listitem.para: Click on the Cluster Processes link under Topology.

Click on the myroxie link.
myroxie link
Press the Submit button to start preflight.

sect2.title: EXPECTED RESULTS
sect2.para: After pressing Submit, a screen similar to the following should display.
This indicates weather the Roxies are up and running, and some information about them.

chapter.title: Certify Thor & Roxie
chapter.para: The following sections will help you to Certify that the Thor and Roxie components of your system are all working correctly.

sect1.title: Generate Certification data file
sect1.para: The following components require using the ECL IDE. If you do not have ECL IDE then follow steps one through four to Install the ECL IDE and HPCC Client Tools. If you already have ECL IDE then start on step four.

listitem.para: In your browser, go to the HPCC Systems web portal, http://hpccsystems.com/download and on that page there is a ECL IDE & Client tools link where you can download the ECL IDE.***
If you have the optional Client Tools package installed. From ECLWatch page, click on the Browse link under the Resources section in the menu on the left hand side.***
This will take you to a page where you can download the ECL IDE Installer. Click on the link to the ECL IDE and download.

row.entry: Save this file to your PC and then run the installâ€”do not run directly from your browser. This is a Windows installer for a Windows application.

listitem.para: Install the ECL IDE, following the prompts in the installer. Once the ECL IDE is installed successfully, you can proceed to the next steps.
Open ECL IDE

para.emphasis: Enter the Login ID and Password provided.

listitem.para:
Open the _Certification.BuildDataFiles attribute in a Builder Window.
In the lower right corner of the ECL IDE you will see a section labeled as Repository, containing a few folders. These folders contain the ECL attributes. Select the "+" sign next to Samples, open the folder.
Navigate to the _Certification folder and select the "+" sign next to it to open it and view the contents.
Sample ECL attributes
Double-click on the BuildDataFiles attribute to open it in the Builder window.
In the builder window, Select thor as Target from the drop menu on the right side.
Press the Submit button.

sect1.para: Note: This code generates a data file and writes it to disk.

sect2.title: EXPECTED RESULT:
sect2.para: Look for the Green checkmark indicating successful completion

listitem.para: Open ECLWatch and look at the execution graph. This illustrates the steps of the query in real-time.
This process generates 2,000,000 - 47-byte records in a file with the logical name of thor::full_test_distributed
Note: The filename and other variables are defined in the _Certification.Setup attribute.
View the result by selecting the Result1 box (should be similar to the following):
Certify Data Refinery full sort capabilities
Certify Data Refinery local sort capabilities
Certify Data Refinery local dedup capabilities
Certify Data Refinery hash dedup capabilities
Certify Data Refinery compress I/O capabilities
Certify Data Refinery string search capabilities

sect2.title: Certify DR

listitem.para: Open ECL IDE

para.emphasis: Enter the Login ID and Password.

listitem.para: Open _Certification.Certify_DR in a Builder Window.

In the lower right corner of the ECL IDE you will see a section labeled as Repository, containing a few folders. This contains the ECL attributes. Select the "+" sign next to it Samples, open the folder.
Navigate to the _Certification folder and select the "+" sign next to it to open it and view the contents.
Double-click on the Certify_DR attribute to open it in the Builder window.
In the builder window, Select thor as Target from the drop menu on the right side.
Press the Submit button.

sect2.para: Note: This Attribute uses the previously generated data and tests a series of Data Refinery capabilities. It does not write data to disk. It will take a few minutes to complete.

sect2.title: EXPECTED RESULT
sect2.para: Look for the Green checkmark indicating successful completion.
The ECL Watch Results tab section should be as follows:

blockquote.para: Result 1 Full Global Join - should = 2 million : 2000000
Result 8 Global Grouped Rollup (Should be 2 records): 2
Result 10 Local Grouped Rollup (Should be 2 records): 2
Result 12 Global Grouped It/Srt/Ddp (Should be 2 records): 2
Result 14 Local Grouped It/Srt/Ddp (Should be 2 records): 2

sect1.title: Certify Key build capabilities
sect1.para: This section will certify that the Data Delivery Engine can perform its key build capabilities.

sect2.title: Certify DDE

listitem.para: Open ECL IDE

para.emphasis: Enter the Login ID and Password.

listitem.para: Open _Certification.build_index in a Builder Window.

In the lower right corner of the ECL IDE you will see a section labeled as Repository, containing a couple of folders. This contains the ECL attributes. Select the "+" sign next to it Samples, open the folder.
Navigate to the _Certification folder and select the "+" sign next to it to open it and view the contents.
Double-click on the build_index attribute to open it in the Builder window.
In the builder window, Select thor as Target from the drop menu on the right side.
Press the Submit button.

sect2.para: Note: This Attribute uses the previously generated data and tests a series of Data Refinery capabilities. It does not write data to disk. It will take a few minutes to complete.

sect2.title: EXPECTED RESULT
sect2.para: Look for the Green checkmark indicating successful completion.
The file we created earlier is indexed by Last Name and the index file, thor::full_test_distributed_index, is written to disk.

listitem.para: Return to the ECLWatch instance in your browser. (http://yourIPaddress:8010/)
Click on the Browse Logical Files link under DFU Files.
Click on the button next to the file listing for thor::full_test_distributed_index , then select Details to open the logical file statistics.

sect1.title: Certify Thor Access to Indexed Data
sect1.para: This section will Certify Thor access to indexed data.

sect2.title: Certify Thor Access
sect2.para: steps.

listitem.para: Open _Certification.read_index in a Builder Window.

In the lower right corner of the ECL IDE you will see a section labeled as Repository, containing a couple of folders. This contains the ECL attributes. Select the "+" sign next to it Samples, open the folder.
Navigate to the _Certification folder and select the "+" sign next to it to open it and view the contents.
Double-click on the read_index attribute to open it in the Builder window.
In the builder window, Select thor as Target from the drop menu on the right side.
Press the Submit button.

sect2.title: EXPECTED RESULT:
sect2.para: The first 100 records from the query should display, looking similar to the following (BRYANT in last name).

sect1.title: Compile and deploy Indexed data to Thor

listitem.para: Open _Certification.read_index in a Builder Window, If you do not have it open already.

In the lower right corner of the ECL IDE you will see a section labeled as Repository, containing a couple of folders. This contains the ECL attributes. Select the "+" sign next to it Samples, open the folder.
Navigate to the _Certification folder and select the "+" sign next to it to open it and view the contents.
Double-click on the read_index attribute to open it in the Builder window.
In the builder window, Select thor as Target from the drop menu on the right side.
In the Builder window, in the upper left corner the Submit button has a drop down arrow next to it. Select the arrow to expose the Compile option.
Select Compile from the menu under the submit button.
Look for the Green checkmark indicating successful completion. Once complete, select the workunit next to the the green checkmark.
Select the ECL Watch button at the lower left corner of your builder window.
Select the Publish button from the ECL Watch tab that you just opened. (you may have to scroll down the main window) ECL Watch Publish button
Using your browser, navigate to the WsECL Web page: http://IPaddress:8002
Select the "+" sign next to thor, to expand the folder
Select read_index.1*** (Option Not available) Alt: Select read_index
Enter the name BRYANT in the lname field.*** Alt: Select output format from drop down box.
Press the submit button there. (This will display the query in the raw XML.) ***

sect2.title: EXPECTED RESULT: ***
sect2.para: A list of 100 records should display, looking similar to the following (BRYANT in last name).

sect1.title: Compile and deploy Indexed data to Roxie

listitem.para: Open _Certification.read_index in a Builder Window, If you do not have it open already.

In the lower right corner of the ECL IDE you will see a section labeled as Repository, containing a couple of folders. This contains the ECL attributes. Select the "+" sign next to it Samples, open the folder.
Navigate to the _Certification folder and select the "+" sign next to it to open it and view the contents.
Double-click on the read_index attribute to open it in the Builder window.
In the builder window, Select roxie as Target from the drop menu on the right side.
In the Builder window, in the upper left corner the Submit button has a drop down arrow next to it. Select the arrow to expose the Compile option.
Select Compile from the menu under the submit button. This may take a minute or two.
Look for the Green checkmark indicating successful completion. Once complete, select the workunit next to the the green checkmark.
Select the ECL Watch button at the lower left corner of your builder window.
Select the Publish button from the ECL Watch tab that you just opened. (you may have to scroll down the main window) ECL Watch Publish button
Using your browser, navigate to the ESP Web page: http://IPaddress:8050***
Select the Deployments tab to display the available workunits. Look for your workunit.
Select the box next to your workunit.
Press the Deploy button at the bottom of that window.
Select the Queries tab. Verify that your request is deployed. ***
Using your browser, navigate to the WsECL Web page: http://IPaddress:8002
Select the "+" sign next to myroxie, to expand the folder
Select your workunit. Enter BRYANT in the lastname field. ***
Press the submit button. *** ***

sect2.title: EXPECTED RESULT: ***
sect2.para: A list of 100 records should display, looking similar to the following (BRYANT in last name).

sect1.title: Certify Roxie access to indexed data
sect1.para: This section certifies the two one-way RDDE components and the 4Way RDDE. You will run these steps three times (once for each RDDE). Note that the URLs for 1st RDDE are in blue, the 2nd RDDEâ€™s are in green, and the third are in orange

sect2.title: Deploy the query to the Rapid Data Delivery Engine access to indexed data.

listitem.para: In a new browser window, open the RoxieConfig web page:

sect2.para: Use the same credentials to login

listitem.para: Expand the roxieattributeserver >> _Certification branch in the left side menu tree.
Rt-click on the ReadIndexDoxie link and select Import.
Press the Check button
Scroll to the right and make sure the check reports OK.
Select Activate from the drop list.
Press the Deploy button button.

sect2.title: EXPECTED RESULT
sect2.para: The query now shows in the Deployed Queries list.

listitem.para: In a new browser window, open the RDDE WsECL web page: http://IPaddress:8022
Use the same credentials to login
Expand the Modules >> _Certification branch in the left side menu tree.
Click on the ReadIndexDoxie link.
Enter BRYANT in the Last Name field (lnamein).
Press the Submit button.

sect2.title: EXPECTED RESULT
sect2.para: A list of 100 records should display, looking similar to the following (BRYANT in last name).

chapter.title: Spray and Despray Data
chapter.para: This Chapter will verify the systems ability to Spray and Despray data. Spraying and Despraying is the means by which the HPCC will distribute data across the system clusters.

Spraying takes a file and distributes pieces of it across the nodes. Despray is the opposite, the system combines the data from the multiple clusters into a singular file that would get delivered back to the user.

sect1.title: Certify Data Transfer (Spray)
sect1.para: The file will be sprayed from the Landing Zone to the Data Refinery, this will certify that data can be moved from Landing Zone to the Data Refinery.

listitem.para: To verify the spray, in ECL Watch, select the Logical Files link under DFU Files.
Click on the button next to the file listing for tutorial::yn::originalperson, (where the yn are your initials) then select Details to open the logical file statistics.
View the details.

sect1.title: Certify Data Retrieval (DeSpray)
sect1.para: The next step to verify that your system is working properly is to test the Despray capabilities. Despray is when the system combines the data from the multiple clusters into a singular file that can be moved to the Landing Zone from the Data Refinery.

sect2.title: DeSpray from ECL Watch
sect2.para: Despray is the opposite of spraying, is a good way to certify that piece is working properly.

listitem.para: To despray, go to ECL Watch in a browser window: http://IPaddress:8010/
Replace IPaddress with the actual IP address of your system, where ECL Watch is loaded.
Select the Browse Logical Files link under DFU Files.
Click on the button next to the file listing for thor::full_test_distributed, then select Despray.

sect3.title: EXPECTED RESULTS:
sect3.para: Upon completion of the despray operation you will have a singular file. You can then retrieve the file from the landing zone. This will certify that the despray operation is working correctly.
